turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: No dates indicated, placed on the shelves in no discernible order.  It's just his mind poured out on paper.  I don't think it's going to give us any specifics.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Looking around... I've got a bad feeling these murders are his life's work.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: He's preaching.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: These murders are his masterwork.  His sermon to all of us.  To all us sinners.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: The irony is, after a day of the type of work he did, he'd come home and read me these morbid crime stories.  Murders in the Rue Morgue.  Le Fanu's Green Tea.  My mother would give him hell because he was keeping me up till all hours.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Sounds like a father who wanted his son to follow in his footsteps.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: One birthday he gave me this brand new hardcover book, "The Century of the Detective," by Jurgen Thorwald.  It traced the history of deduction as a science, and it sealed my fate, because it was real, not fiction.  And, that a drop of blood or a piece of hair could solve a crime... it was incredible to me.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: You know... there's not going to be a happy ending to this.  It's not possible anymore.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: If we get him, I'll be happy enough.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: No.  Face it now.  Stop thinking it's good guys against bad guys.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: How can you say that?  Especially after today?

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Don't try to focus on things as black and white, because you'll go blind.  There's no winning and losing here.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: You're the oldest man I know, Somerset.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: You tell me, then... you walk into an apartment, and a man has beaten his wife to death, or the wife murdered the husband, and you have to wash the blood off their children.  You put the killer in jail.  Who won?

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: You do your job...

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Where's the victory?

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: You follow the law and do the best you can. It's all there.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Just know that in this case there's not going to be any satisfaction.  If we caught John Doe and he were the devil himself, if it turned out he were actually Satan, then, that might live up to our expectations.  No human being could do these things, right? But, this is not the devil.  It's just a man.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Why don't you shut the fuck up for a while? You bitch and complain... if I thought like you, I would have slit my wrist already.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: You think you're preparing me for the hard times ahead?  You think you're toughening me up?  Well, you're not!  You're quitting, fine... but I'm staying.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: People don't want a champion.  They just want to keep playing the lottery and eating hamburgers.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: What the fuck is wrong with you?  What burnt you out?

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: It wasn't one thing, if that's what you mean.  I just... I can't live here anymore. I can't live where stupidity is embraced and nurtured as if it were a virtue.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Oh, you're so much better than everyone, right?  No one's worthy of you.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Wrong!  I sympathize completely, because if you can't win... then, if you don't ignore everything and everyone around you, you... you become like John Doe.  It's easier to beat a child than it is to raise it, because it takes so much work to love.  You just have to make sure you don't stop to think about the abuse, and the damage, because you'll risk being sad.  Keep ignoring.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: You're talking about people who are mentally ill.  You're...

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: No I'm not!  I'm talking about common, everyday life here.  If you let yourself worry about one thing, you'll worry about the next, and the next, and it never ends. In this place, ignorance isn't just bliss, it's a matter of survival.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Listen to yourself.  You say, "the problem with people is they don't care, so I don't care about people."  But, you're already here.  You've been here a long time.  So, there's a part of you that knows, even if everything you say is true, none of it matters.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: That part of me is dead.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: He cut her up and dressed the wounds.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Call for help, and you'll live.  But, you'll be disfigured.  Or, put yourself out of your misery.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Oh, you want to stay now?

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: One of two things will happen.  We're either going to get John Doe, or he'll finish his series of seven, and this case will go on for years.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: You think you're doing me a big favor by staying?

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: I'm requesting you keep me on as your partner a few more days.  You'd be doing me the favor.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: You knew I'd say yes.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: No, actually, I wasn't sure at all.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: As soon as this is over, I'm gone.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Big surprise.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Because he is John Doe, by choice.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: When do we get to question him?

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: You know he's fucking us.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: You and I are, probably for the first time ever, in total agreement.  He wouldn't just stop.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Well... what the fuck, man?

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: He's only two murders away from finishing his masterpiece, right?  Can you even conceive of what's going to happen next?  I mean, can you even imagine how he'll try to finish it?

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: I can tell you this.  I recognize his lawyer.  His name's Mark Swarr.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: If John Doe's head splits open and a U.F.O. flies out, I want you to have expected it.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: I will.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Well, I have to tell you...  I think I've fallen in love with you.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Slut.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Kiss me on the lips.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Give me a break.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Stay with him.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Wait!

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: There's no time to discuss it!

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Throw your gun down now!

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: What are you talking about?  What happened?

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Throw your weapon, detective!  Now!

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Tell me it's not true.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: I can't let you do this...

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Put your gun down!!

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Don't do this... please...

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Put the gun down, Somerset!

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: I'm sorry about this, Mrs. Gould.  I really am.

turns.speaker: MRS GOULD
turns.text: I... I don't understand.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: I need you to look at each one carefully... very carefully.  Look for anything that seems strange or out of place.  Anything at all.

turns.speaker: MRS GOULD
turns.text: I don't know why... why now?

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Please, I need you to help me if we're going to get who did this.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Anything... anything missing or different.

turns.speaker: MRS GOULD
turns.text: I don't see anything.

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: Are you absolutely certain?

turns.speaker: MRS GOULD
turns.text: I can't do this now... please.

turns.speaker: MRS GOULD
turns.text: This painting...

turns.speaker: MILLS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MRS GOULD
turns.text: Why is this painting hanging upside-down?

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: It's nice to meet you.  My husband has told me a lot about you... except your first name.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Oh... um, William.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: It's a nice name.  William, I'd like you to meet David.  David... William.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: It smells good.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: What?  Oh, yes.  I mean, thank you.  Please, sit down.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: I hear you and Mills were high school sweethearts.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: High school and college, yes.  Pretty hokey, huh?  I knew on our first date this was the man I was going to marry.  God... he was the funniest man I'd ever met.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Don't worry.  I don't wear it at the dinner table.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: No matter how often I see guns, I still can't get used to them.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: You have a strange way about you... I mean interesting.  I'm sorry.  It's really none of my business.  It's just nice to meet a man who talks like that.  If David saw that paper, he'd say you're a fag.  That's how he is.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: I guess I won't be showing it to him then.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: I was close once.  It just didn't happen.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: It surprises me.  It really does.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Any person who spends a significant amount of time with me finds me... disagreeable. Just ask your husband.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: How long have you lived here?

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Too long.  What do you think so far?

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: I don't know, with this case.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: If you can, please call me.  Please.  I have to go now... goodnight.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: I mean, you known this city.  You've been here for so long.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: It's a hard place.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: I don't sleep very well.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: I feel strange being here with you... without David knowing.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: I'm sorry, I only...

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: Perfect example.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: You have to put blinders on sometimes. Most times.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: I don't know why I asked you to come.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Talk to him about it.  He'll understand if you tell him how you feel.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: I can't be a burden, especially now.  I know I'll get used to things.  I guess I wanted to know what someone who's lived here thinks.  Upstate, it was a completely different environment.  I don't know if David told you, but I teach fifth grade, or did.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: He mentioned it.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: I've been going to some of the schools, looking for work, but the conditions here are... horrible.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: You should look into private schools.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Oh, Tracy... I have to tell you, I'm not the one to talk to about this.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: I hate this city.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Well, I got up one morning and went to work... just like any other day, except it was my first since hearing about the baby. And, I... I felt this fear and anxiety washing over me.  I looked around, and I thought, how can we raise a child surrounded by all this?  How can a child grow up here?  So, that night, I told her I didn't want us to have it, and over the next few weeks, I convinced her it was wrong.  I mean... I wore her down, slowly.

turns.speaker: TRACY
turns.text: I want to have children.  It's just...

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: I can tell you now, I know... I'm positive I made the right decision.  I'm positive. But, there's never a day that passes that I don't wish I had decided differently.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Neighbors heard them screaming at each other for like two hours.  It was nothing new.  But, then they heard the gun go off. Both barrels.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Did the wife confess?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: When the patrolman came she was trying put his head back together.  She was crying too hard to say anything.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Why always like this?  Only after the fact... this sudden realization, that if you shoot someone, or stick a knife in them, that person will cease to exist.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Crime of passion.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Yes.  Look at all the passion splattered up on the wall here.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: This is a done deal.  All but the paperwork.

turns.speaker: SOMERSET
turns.text: Did their son see it happen?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: AARON
turns.text: How's California?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: How should I know?

turns.speaker: AARON
turns.text: But Mose Harper said...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: That old goat still creakin' around?...Whyn't someone bury him?

turns.speaker: AARON
turns.text: It was Ethan found you squallin' in a sage clump after your folks was massacred...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: It just happened to be me...No need to make any more of it...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Passed the Todd place comin' in... What happened to 'em?

turns.speaker: AARON
turns.text: They gave up...went back to the cotton rows...So'd the Jamisons... Without Martha, I don't know...She wouldn't let a man quit.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You askin' me to clear out now?

turns.speaker: AARON
turns.text: You're my brother...You're welcome to stay as long as you got a mind to...Ain't that so, Martha?

turns.speaker: AARON
turns.text: Now, Ethan, I ain't sure...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Don't argue!...And stay close... Maybe they're rustlers...and maybe this dodderin' old idiot ain't so far wrong...

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: Lucy's going on seventeen now...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: An' she's got a beau! Kisses him, too!

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: That's enough...Go on inside and help Lucy set the table...You, too, Deborah!

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: Not tonight...Ben, put that sword back.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: It's not a sword, ma...It's a sabre!  Did you kill many damYankees with this sabre, Uncle Ethan?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: It's all right, ma...I been watchin'... Only I wish...

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: What, Ben?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I wish Uncle Ethan was here. Don't you, ma?

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Killed every one -- an' not for food either...Why'd they do a thing like that?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Stealing the cattle was just to pull us out...This here's a murder raid...  It shapes up to scald out either your place...or my brother's.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Let's get along...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Why don't you finish the job?

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: They got to stop <U>sometime</U>...if they're human at all, they got to stop!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Naw...a human man rides a horse till it dies...then he goes on afoot...A Comanche comes along...gets that horse up...and rides it twenty more miles...Then he eats it.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: You've said that enough!...Maybe Lucy's dead...maybe they're both dead...but if I hear it from you again, I'll fight ya, Mr. Edwards!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: That'll be the day!...Let's ride.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Why'd they break off?  Was there water in that canyon?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Huh...? No...no water.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What you saw wasn't Lucy.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: It was, I tell you!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What you saw was a buck wearin' Lucy's dress...  I found Lucy back there in that canyon...I wrapped her in my blanket an' buried her with m'own hands...I thought it best to keep it from you -- long as I could.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: <U>Charlie</U> <U>MacCorry</U>!...You weren't fixin' to marry HIM??

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: She sure is!...An' don't think your comin' back is goin' to change it!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: As to that, I don't know, Charlie... We hadn't got around to talkin' marriage...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What right you got to be talkin' marriage to any decent woman...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: If you're talkin' about that crazy murder charge...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: AND other things...Mebbe you thought you was gettin' away with being comical about that Indian wife you took...I bet she wasn't the first squaw you...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: It's all right...Charlie, let's move outside.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I ain't wearing no gun.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Another one, eh?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: This 'un come a long way 'fore he died.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Well, that's seven we can score up to your brother, Ethan.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Is this in the line of duty, sergeant?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No sir...pleasure.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: In that case, give the boys room...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: You all right, sergeant?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Dunno...Seems so.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Well, go get cleaned up and we'll proceed with the weddin'...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You're goin' if the captain says you're goin'...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Now, now...let's not grow dis- putatious...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Ethan, you an' Martin are hereby appointed civilian scouts -- without pay...Charlie, hightail it to head- quarters an' spread the word...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yes sir...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Haven't seen you since the surrender.  Come to think of it, I didn't see you <U>at</U> the surrender.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I don't believe in surrenderin'...I still got my sabre, Reverend...never turned it into any ploughshare neither!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You ain't goin'...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: He sure <U>is</U> goin'...He's sworn in.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Well, swear him out again!...I'll go with you.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You can forget that...  Wouldn't be legal anyway.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Why?  You wanted for a crime, Ethan?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You askin' as a Reverend or a Captain, Sam?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I'm askin' as a Ranger of the sovereign state of Texas.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Got a warrant?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: You fit a lot of descriptions.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I figger a man's only good for one oath at a time...I took mine to the Confederate States of America...  So did you, Reverend...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: He cometh forth like a...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Amen!...Put an 'amen' to it!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: ...like a flower and is cut down... <U>Amen</U>!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: What good does that do?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: By what you preach...none!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: They're camped by the river -- 'bout twenty miles from here. Soon's it gets dark we'll circle out so's to jump 'em before day- break.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: You're right sure you want to <U>jump</U> 'em, Ethan?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: It's what we're here for, ain't it?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I thought we were trying to get the girls back -- <U>alive</U>...We jump those Comanches, they'll kill 'em...You know that!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What do you know about it?...What's a quarter-breed Cherokee know about the Comanche trick of sleeping with his best pony tied right beside him...You got as much chance of stampedin' their herd as...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: ...as you have of findin' those girls alive by ridin' into 'em... I say we do it my way, Ethan...and that's an order!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Yes, sir...But if you're wrong, <U>Captain</U> Clayton, don't ever give me another!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You got any more orders, Captain?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Just keep goin'...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: If you were tryin' to surround 'em, you sure succeeded.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: How far's the river from here, Mose?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I didn't give any order to fire!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: That's all right, Captain...I don't need any formal invitation to kill a Comanch...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: You got one now!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Evenin'...evenin' Reverend...or do I call you 'Captain'...?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Came here for a wedding, Ethan... Until that's over, I reckon 'reverend' will do...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Fight fair, son...Use your fists!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Comanches don't use their fists, reverend...Let 'em alone...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I got to ask you and Martin to ride to the State Capitol with me, Ethan.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: This an invite to a necktie party, Reverend?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: <U>Captain</U>...Nope, wouldn't say that... Likely you had your reasons for killin' Futterman...Probably needed killin'...I'm speaking as a ranger now, not as a reverend...Fact that all three was shot in the back is the only thing that's raised some question -- that and a missin' gold piece known to have been on him just prior to his demise.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: We can get within 500 yards...there's a hogback to the south.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: How many, would you say?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Enough to go around...I'd say about a dozen apiece...Mount 'em up!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Now son, it's a bitter thing to say, but there's more than your sister at stake here.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: There sure is! I'm going to tell you somethin'...I wasn't going to speak of it...But I'll tell you now. Did you notice them scalps strung on Scar's lance?  Did you see the third scalp from the point of the lance? Long... wavy hair...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I didn't <U>want</U> to tell you...but maybe it's your right to know.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Now mount up, son...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I say NO!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Go ahead, son...But at the first alarm, we're comin' in -- and we ain't goin' to have time to pick and choose our targets when we do...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: What in...?

turns.speaker: GREENHILL
turns.text: Captain Clayton...Captain!

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Go on! Whyn't you have your bugler sound the charge while you're at it??

turns.speaker: GREENHILL
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Never mind...Your pa know you're out here?

turns.speaker: GREENHILL
turns.text: Yes, sir...Troop's about ten miles back...The Colonel sent me looking for you...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Well you found me...Good work, son...Good work.

turns.speaker: GREENHILL
turns.text: If there's anything I can do, sir...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: God forbid...No, son, you flog on back and tell your pa where we're at...and where he's at...

turns.speaker: GREENHILL
turns.text: But he knows THAT, sir...Can't I stay, sir?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: All right...But keep your eye on me, boy...I'm the hard case you're up against here -- not these childish savages...If you don't hear me first time I holler, you better read my mind...I don't aim to raise no two hollers on any subject at hand...

turns.speaker: GREENHILL
turns.text: Yes, sir...

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Is Captain Clayton here, Reverend?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: I'm Clayton.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Colonel Greenhill's compliments, sir. The Colonel wishes to know how soon you could put a company of Rangers in the field, fully armed and...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Hold on, son...Who's this Colonel Greenhill you're talking about?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Why Colonel Greenhill is Colonel Greenhill, sir...Commanding Officer, Fifth U.S. Cavalry...I'm Lieutenant Greenhill, sir.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Oh...Now what's this your pa wants to know?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: My pa wants to know...<U>Colonel</U> <U>Greenhill</U> wants to know how soon you could put a company of your Rangers in the field, fully armed and equipped, for joint punitive action against the Comanches.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: JOINT action?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Yes sir...We've received information about a band of Comanches under a chief named Scar...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: And what makes you think he's in this territory?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Yesterday, one of our patrols picked up a man claims he was a prisoner with Scar till only two days ago... He talks crazy but I brought him along...Says he lives here...keeps mentioning a rocking chair.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: You tell your pa a company of Rangers -- all fourteen of 'em -- fully armed an' equipped will be in the field by daylight...headin' for the south end of the Malapai. If he can catch up with us, well an' good...

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: But...but captain, we can't possibly take the field tomorrow...for your own protection...

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Sonny, yonder's a passel of murderers, complete with Texican scalps an' white girl captive...You want to protect us, you just get out of our way...Now <U>skedaddle</U>!

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Martin! Ride me as far as the well!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Grab hold!...

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Unnt-meah!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: We ain't goin'! We ain't goin' without you, Debbie...Ethan, get the horses...I'll try to keep her talkin'...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I don't care what they've done to you...what happened...

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: They have done...nothing...They are my people...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: No Debbie! That ain't what happened! They been lyin' to you...

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: You lie! All white men lie...and kill...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Debbie, think back! I'm Martin... remember? Remember how I used to let you ride my horse? Tell you stories? Don't you remember me, Debbie?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I remember...from always...At first I prayed to you...come and get me... Take me home...You didn't come...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I've come now...

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: These are my people...  Unnt-meah! Go! Go! <U>Please</U>!

turns.speaker: MOSE
turns.text: Ay-eh...They was here...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: SURE!...They <U>WERE</U> here...Now they're out there...an' waitin' to jump us!...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Steady, Daniel Boone! You don't want to miss...It makes them think their medicine's stronger than yours...

turns.speaker: MOSE
turns.text: Ay-eh...That's jest what I tole Joe Powers...That un's gettin' kinda sassy, ain't he, Ethan?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Leggo my arm...You look mangier 'n ever.

turns.speaker: MOSE
turns.text: Ain't been too good...No sir, not too good...Gettin' old, Ethan...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You were born old...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Well, the reward still stands...

turns.speaker: MOSE
turns.text: Don't want no money, Ethan...jus' a place -- a roof over m' head...a little grub...a bunk to sleep in... an' a rockin' chair by the fire... my own rockin' chair by a fire...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You help me find her, you got your rockin' chair...

turns.speaker: MOSE
turns.text: Swear it, Ethan?...Given word?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Told ya, didn't I?

turns.speaker: MOSE
turns.text: Ethan...I found a man's seen her... knows where little Debbie is!

turns.speaker: MOSE
turns.text: Come f'r my rockin' chai'...ole Mose.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Where's Scar, Mose...SCAR?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Mose...try to remember!...You were in Scar's camp...

turns.speaker: MOSE
turns.text: Ay-eh...Made out I was crazy...  Ate dirt...chewed grass...I fooled 'em, Ethan!...an' I got away...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Scar! Where's he holed in?

turns.speaker: MOSE
turns.text: Seven Fingers...ay-eh...Seven...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: How'd you come by this?

turns.speaker: FUTTERMAN
turns.text: You said there'd be a thousand dollar reward.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: That's what I said.

turns.speaker: FUTTERMAN
turns.text: You got it with you?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Talk!

turns.speaker: FUTTERMAN
turns.text: A young buck fetched it in late last summer...  Said it belonged to a captive chile of Chief Scar...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Scar? Never heard of any Chief Scar.

turns.speaker: FUTTERMAN
turns.text: Me neither...But this buck claimed he was a big war chief with the Nawyecky Comanches.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Keep talking.

turns.speaker: FUTTERMAN
turns.text: Scar's band was headin' north...to winter in at Fort Wingate...eatin' agency beef. That's what this buck said...Maybe he lied.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: And maybe you lie...

turns.speaker: FUTTERMAN
turns.text: In that case you won't find her -- and I won't get my thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: FUTTERMAN
turns.text: Don't forget to come back with my thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Ain't yours yet.
